To convert a boolean array to binary and vice versa in Java, you can use the following code:

// Convert boolean array to binary
public static int booleanArrayToBinary(boolean[] booleanArray) {
    int binary = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < booleanArray.length; i++) {
        if (booleanArray[i]) {
            binary |= (1 << i);
        }
    }
    return binary;
}

// Convert binary to boolean array
public static boolean[] binaryToBooleanArray(int binary, int size) {
    boolean[] booleanArray = new boolean[size];
    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
        booleanArray[i] = ((binary >> i) & 1) == 1;
    }
    return booleanArray;
}

<<<explanation>>>: 
To convert a boolean array to binary, you can iterate over the boolean array and use bitwise operations to set the corresponding bits in the binary representation. The code uses the left shift operator (<<) to shift the value 1 to the correct position and the bitwise OR operator (|) to set the bit.

To convert binary to a boolean array, you can iterate over the bits of the binary representation and use bitwise operations to extract the individual bits. The code uses the right shift operator (>>) to shift the bits to the correct position and the bitwise AND operator (&) to extract the bit.

Please note that the size parameter in the binaryToBooleanArray method is used to specify the size of the boolean array.
